register.name: FCLKDIV
register.description: Flash Clock Divider Register\n Used to control timed events in program and erase algorithms.\n NOTE: The FCLKDIV register must not be written while a flash command is executing (FSTAT[CCIF] = 0)

field.name: FDIV
field.description: Clock Divider Bits\n FDIV[5:0] must be set to effectively divide BUSCLK down to 1MHz to control timed events during flash program and erase algorithms

field.name: FDIVLCK
field.description: Clock Divider Locked

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: FDIV field is open for writing

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: FDIV value is locked and cannot be changed. After the lock bit is set high, only reset can clear this bit and restore writability to the FDIV field in user mode

field.name: FDIVLD
field.description: Clock Divider Loaded

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: FCLKDIV register has not been written since the last reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: FCLKDIV register has been written since the last reset

register.name: FSEC
register.description: Flash Security Register\n The FSEC register holds all bits associated with the security of the MCU and NVM module. All fields in the FSEC register are readable but not writable. During the reset sequence, the FSEC register is loaded with the contents of the flash security byte in the flash configuration field located in flash memory

field.name: SEC
field.description: Flash Security Bits\n Defines the security state of the MCU. If the flash module is unsecured using backdoor key access, the SEC field is forced to 10.\n NOTE: 01 is the preferred SEC state to set MCU to secured state

field.name: KEYEN
field.description: Backdoor Key Security Enable Bits\n The KEYEN[1:0] bits define the enabling of backdoor key access to the flash module. \n NOTE: 01 is the preferred KEYEN state to disable backdoor key access

register.name: FCCOBIX
register.description: Flash CCOB Index Register\n The FCCOBIX register is used to index the FCCOB register for NVM memory operations

field.name: CCOBIX
field.description: Common Command Register Index\n Selects which word of the FCCOB register array is being read or written to

register.name: FCNFG
register.description: Flash Configuration Register\n The FCNFG register enables the flash command complete interrupt and forces ECC faults on flash array read access from the CPU

field.name: FSFD
field.description: Force Single Bit Fault Detect\n The FSFD bit allows the user to simulate a single bit fault during flash array read operations and check the associated interrupt routine. This field is cleared by writing a 0 to FSFD

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Flash array read operations will set the SFDIF flag in the FERSTAT register only if a single bit fault is detected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Flash array read operation will force the SFDIF flag in the FERSTAT register to be set and an interrupt will be generated as long as FERCNFG[SFDIE] is set

field.name: FDFD
field.description: Force Double Bit Fault Detect\n Allows the user to simulate a double-bit fault during flash array read operations and check the associated interrupt routine. This field is cleared by writing a 0 to FDFD

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Flash array read operations will set the FERSTAT[DFDIF] flag only if a double bit fault is detected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Any flash array read operation will force the FERSTAT[DFDIF] flag to be set and an interrupt will be generated as long as FERCNFG[DFDIE] is set

field.name: IGNSF
field.description: Ignore Single Bit Fault\n Controls single-bit fault reporting in the FERSTAT register

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: All single-bit faults detected during array reads are reported

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Single-bit faults detected during array reads are not reported and the single bit fault interrupt will not\n be generated

field.name: CCIE
field.description: Command Complete Interrupt Enable\n Controls interrupt generation when a flash command has completed

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be requested whenever the CCIF flag in the FSTAT register is set

register.name: FERCNFG
register.description: Flash Error Configuration Register\n The FERCNFG register enables the flash error interrupts for the FERSTAT flags

field.name: SFDIE
field.description: Single Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Enable\n Controls interrupt generation when a single bit fault is detected during a flash block read operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: SFDIF interrupt is disabled whenever the SFDIF flag is set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be requested whenever the SFDIF flag is set

field.name: DFDIE
field.description: Double Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Enable\n Controls interrupt generation when a double-bit fault is detected during a flash block read operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be requested whenever the DFDIF flag is set

register.name: FSTAT
register.description: Flash Status Register\n The FSTAT register reports the operational status of the flash and EEPROM module

field.name: MGSTAT
field.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag\n One or more MGSTAT flag bits are set if an error is detected during execution of a flash command or during the flash reset sequence

field.name: MGBUSY
field.description: Memory Controller Busy Flag\n Reflects the active state of the memory controller

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Memory controller is busy executing a flash command (CCIF = 0)

field.name: FPVIOL
field.description: Flash Protection Violation Flag\n Indicates an attempt was made to program or erase an address in a protected area of flash or EEPROM memory. Write 1 to FPVIOL to clear it. While FPIOL is set, it is not possible to launch a command or start a command write sequence

field.name: ACCERR
field.description: Flash Access Error Flag\n Indicates an illegal access has occurred to the flash memory caused by either a violation of the command write sequence or issuing an illegal flash command. While ACCERR is set, the CCIF flag cannot be cleared to launch a command. Write a 1 to this field to clear it

field.name: CCIF
field.description: Command Complete Interrupt Flag\n Indicates that a flash command has completed. The CCIF flag is cleared by writing a 1 to CCIF to launch a command and CCIF will stay low until command completion or command violation

register.name: FERSTAT
register.description: Flash Error Status Register\n The FERSTAT register reflects the error status of internal flash and EEPROM operations

field.name: SFDIF
field.description: Single Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Flag\n With the IGNSF bit in the FCNFG register clear, the SFDIF flag indicates that a single bit fault was detected in the stored parity and data bits during a flash array read operation or that a flash array read operation returning invalid data was attempted on a flash block that was under a flash command operation. The SFDIF flag is cleared by writing a 1 to SFDIF. Writing a 0 to SFDIF has no effect on SRFDIF

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Single bit fault detected and corrected or a flash array read operation returning invalid data was attempted while command running

field.name: DFDIF
field.description:
Double Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Flag
 The setting of the DFDIF flag indicates that a double bit fault was detected in the stored parity and data bits during a flash array read operation or that a flash array read operation returning invalid data was attempted on a flash block that was under a flash command operation. The DFDIF flag is cleared by writing a 1 to DFDIF. Writing a 0 to DFDIF has no effect on DFDIF. 
 NOTE: The single bit fault and double bit fault flags are mutually exclusive for parity errors, meaning that an ECC fault occurrence can be either single fault or double fault but never both. A simultaneous access collision, when the flash array read operation is returning invalid data attempted while a command is running, is indicated when both SFDIF and DFDIF flags are high. 
 NOTE: There is a one cycle delay in storing the ECC DFDIF and SFDIF fault flags in the register. At least one NOP is required after a flash memory read before checking FERSTAT for the occurrence of EEC errors

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Double bit fault detected or a flash array read operation returning invalid data was attempted while command running

register.name: FPROT
register.description:
Flash Protection Register
 The FPROT register defines which flash sectors are protected against program and erase operations.
 The bits of the FPROT register are writable with the restriction that the size of the protected region can only be increased.
 During the reset sequence, the FPROT register is loaded with the contents of the flash protection byte in the flash configuration field at global address 0x40D located in flash memory

field.name: FPLS
field.description: Flash Protection Lower Address Size\n The FPLS bits determine the size of the protected/unprotected area in flash memory. \n The FPLS bits can only be written to while the FPLDIS bit is set

field.name: FPLDIS
field.description: Flash Protection Lower Address Range Disable\n The FPLDIS bit determines whether there is a protected/unprotected area in a specific region of the flash memory beginning with global address 0x0_0000

field.name: FPHS
field.description: Flash Protection Higher Address Size\n The FPHS bits determine the size of the protected/unprotected area in flash memory. The FPHS bits can be written to only while the FPHDIS bit is set

field.name: FPHDIS
field.description: Flash Protection Higher Address Range Disable\n The FPHDIS bit determines whether there is a protected/unprotected area in a specific region of the flash memory ending with global address 0x7FFF

field.name: FPOPEN
field.description: Flash Protection Operation Enable\n The FPOPEN bit determines the protection function for program or erase operations

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The FPHDIS and FPLDIS fields define unprotected address ranges as specified by the corresponding FPHS and FPLS fields

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The FPHDIS and FPLDIS fields enable protection for the address range specified by the corresponding FPHS and FPLS fields

register.name: EEPROT
register.description:
EEPROM Protection Register
 The EEPROT register defines which EEPROM sectors are protected against program and erase operations.
 The bits of the EEPROT register are writable with the restriction that protection can be added but not removed. 
 During the reset sequence, the DPOPEN and DPS fields of the EEPROT register are loaded with the contents of the EEPROM protection byte in the flash configuration field at global address 0x040C located in flash memory

field.name: DPS
field.description: EEPROM Protection Size\n Determines the size of the protected area in the EEPROM memory

field.name: DPOPEN
field.description: EEPROM Protection Control

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Enables EEPROM memory program and erase protection with range defined by DPS bits

register.name: FCCOB
register.description: Flash Common Command Object Register (FCCOBLO:FCCOBHI)\n The FCCOB is an array of six words addressed via the CCOBIX index found in the FCCOBIX register. \n Byte-wide reads and writes are allowed to the FCCOB register

register.name: FCCOBHI
register.description: Flash Common Command Object Register:High\n High 8 bits of Common Command Object register

register.name: FCCOBLO
register.description: Flash Common Command Object Register:Low\n Low 8 bits of Common Command Object register

register.name: FOPT
register.description: Flash Option Register\n During the reset sequence, the FOPT register is loaded from the flash nonvolatile byte in the flash configuration field at global address 0x040F located in flash memory.\n Usage varies with particular device
